ref: 10759 *rugga -- : rauggho adj. ʻ the whole ʼ (cf. S.). 2. *ruṅga- (X Pk. rujja -- s.v. *rōdya -- ): rūngo (phonet. rvṅgo AKŚ xxvi) m. ʻ tear ʼ, rūṅgāro m. ʻ act of weeping ʼ.

10759 *rugga ʻ defective ʼ. 2. *ruṅga -- . [~ *lugga -- . -- Cf. *rigga -- . Although derived from or colliding with MIA. rugga -- < rugṇá -- (√ruj), it appears to form part of the ʻ defective ʼ word -- group with initial ru -- , rō -- : see list s.v. *rakka -- ]
L. rugg f., (Ju.) rug̠ m. ʻ sandy uncultivated land ʼ;
Or. ruguṛiā ʻ stunted, dwarfish, sickly ʼ, (Sambhalpur) rugā ʻ ailing ʼ (rather < rugṇá -- ).
